content: 3 chain space do the following half_double_crochet half_double_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet dtr treble_crochet chain dtr treble_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet £ make a double_crochet single_crochet into the next st it s a treble_crochet double_crochet from the previous round £ repeat the following 4 times o skip the next st it s a double_crochet single_crochet in the previous round o do a double_crochet single_crochet into the next st it s a treble_crochet double_crochet from the previous round o into the 3 chain space do the following half_double_crochet half_double_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet dtr treble_crochet chain dtr treble_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet o do a double_crochet single_crochet into the next st it s a treble_crochet double_crochet from the previous round £ skip the next st it s a double_crochet single_crochet in the previous round £ do a slip_stitch into the first double_crochet single_crochet where the stitch marker is and then remove the stitch marker £ 45 sts remember that the v of the slip_stitch doesn t count as a st finish off your bright star £ cut off the yarn leaving a 15cm / 6in end £ pull the end through the loop and tighten £ weave in both ends on the back of your star 6 bright star uk and us terminology v1 0 a homelea lass® crochet pattern ©homelea lass 2022 #homelealass homelealass com steam block your bright star we re going to steam block your star to even out the stitches and improve how it looks blocking is magic for crocheting and knitting it uses either water or steam to relax the wool fibres which in turns evens and flattens the stitches as the wool cools and dries it holds the shape it was blocked to grab your ironing board and iron and let s get started £ turn your iron on and set it to the hottest setting with no steam £ put your iron in a safe place where it won t be knocked or touched and let it heat up £ hold your iron about 3cm 1in above your star and evenly steam it so it feels warm all over and then jiggle your star until you re happy with the shape £ turn over your star and then hold your iron about 3cm 1in above your star and evenly steam it so it feels warm all over and then jiggle your star until you re happy with the shape £ allow your star to lie flat until it s cool congratulations congratulations on finishing your bright star it s been an absolute pleasure to help you and i hope you ve enjoyed it let me know how you went by £ sharing a photo on instagram and tagging it with #homelealass @homelealass £ leaving feedback at homelealass com/feedback thank you with love lynda 7 bright star uk and us terminology v1 0 a homelea lass® crochet pattern ©homelea lass 2022 #homelealass homelealass com
